meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a gutter.
meanings.sent1: The house had a guttery roof that collected rainwater efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The guttery downspout was clogged with leaves and debris.
meanings.sent3: The guttery appearance of the old building made it seem like it was always ready for a storm.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a guttery quality, like water flowing through a narrow channel.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a guttery color palette to create a sense of urban decay in the painting.

meanings.definition: A place where gutters are installed.
meanings.sent1: The guttery on the side of the house was overflowing with rainwater.
meanings.sent2: He climbed up the ladder to clean out the guttery before the next storm.
meanings.sent3: The birds found a cozy spot to nest in the guttery above the window.
meanings.sent4: The guttery was painted to match the trim of the house, blending in seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: Water cascaded down the guttery, creating a soothing sound in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was dark and guttery, with trash strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent2: She avoided walking through the guttery park at night.
meanings.sent3: The dog came back from the yard looking guttery after rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent4: His clothes were always a bit guttery after a long day of work in the garage.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house had a guttery yard overgrown with weeds and litter.
